UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile in the PetPal Hub application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user profile.

settings.description: User settings (can be stored as a JSON string).

feederId.description: The ID of the single feeder linked to this user's account. (Relationship: Feeder 1:1 UserProfile)

FeedingSchedule.title: FeedingSchedule
FeedingSchedule.description: Represents a scheduled feeding event for a specific feeder.

id.description: Unique identifier for the feeding schedule.

scheduledTime.description: The time the feeder is scheduled to dispense food.

FeedingLog.title: FeedingLog
FeedingLog.description: Represents a log entry for a feeding event.

id.description: Unique identifier for the feeding log entry.

timestamp.description: The time the feeding event occurred.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is simplified to support one feeder per user. The `feederId` is stored directly in the user's profile (`/users/{userId}`). The `feeders` collection is now at the root level. This enforces a one-to-one relationship between a user and a feeder and simplifies security rules. A user can only access the data of the feeder whose ID is stored in their profile.
